title: Augusta County: Andrew R. Barber to Mary Anna Sibert, August 30, 1864
summary: Barber writes to his cousin, thanking her for her recent letter and complaining that no other family members have yet written to him. He describes the unpleasant duty of reviewing applications for exemption from military service because of injury and worries about the personal effects of long service, noting that "My heart once so full of tender affection seems now to be drying up."
